content.rendered:
As the demand for immersive content and experiences continues to grow, the open-source WebXR WordPress theme is poised to address a significant market need. With an estimated 42% of all websites using WordPress, and a 63% market share of CMSs, the potential reach and impact of the theme are vast. Despite the breathtaking scope of the WordPress ecosystem, only FIVE results return on search for “WebXR” in their plugin directory. Generally, there slow growth in the number of WebXR sites, and this project aims to change that.

Expanding WebXR Ecosystem:

The project aligns with Futurewei’s commitment to building up the WebXR ecosystem by providing an easy-to-use tool for creating immersive web experiences. By making WebXR integration into WordPress seamless, the theme will contribute to the democratization of XR content creation and empower millions of users to create 3D websites.

Market Potential:

The successful integration of WebXR into WordPress has the potential to significantly increase the number of available 3D websites, thereby driving the demand for WebXR-enabled devices and further expanding the ecosystem.

Industry Relationships:

Powersimple has a history of influential work in the XR space, such as the MetaTr@versal series, which was instrumental in founding the Metaverse Standards Forum. The forum now has over 2,400 members, showcasing Powersimple’s ability to bring together industry stakeholders to drive innovation and collaboration.

Hackathons and Collaborative Development:

Participating in hackathons, such as the MIT Reality Hack, will enable the project to benefit from the expertise of developers from around the world. This collaboration will help refine and expand the theme, ensuring it remains at the cutting edge of WebXR development.

Strategic Partnerships:

Working closely with Futurewei’s strategic partnerships team will facilitate the development and promotion of the open-source WebXR WordPress theme. By leveraging Futurewei’s expertise and connections, the project will access resources and forge relationships to drive its success.

By capitalizing on these market opportunities and fostering community engagement, the open-source WebXR WordPress theme can become a driving force in the evolution of the WebXR ecosystem, providing a versatile and accessible tool for developers and content creators alike.

content.rendered:
The theme provides an infrastructure to populate an XR experience with organized data. This allows admins to keep the workflow they are familiar with, while the front-end output is presented in 3D.

One familiar interface, multiple publishing destinations

The utility of this project is not strictly limited to destinations published in WebXR. Native Apps too will be able to access the same data through the REST API, which can be configured to deliver custom schemas as a specific app would require. Moreover, gaming engines could ingest the data and assets provided by the REST API in cases where the content needs to be published.

The purpose of content management is to give autonomy to publishers, allowing for rapid iteration without the friction of specialized developers needing to manually touch every piece of content. Using an open-source infrastructure will provide the capability for plugins to be written to bridge between any publication software that can consume the JSON data from the REST API.

Flexible schemas and taxonomies

The REST API can be customized to query for and return custom data structures which can be consumed by WebXR Apps, PWAs, and Native Apps alike. For example, whether the destination application is written for Android, xrOS, or WebXR;  or whether the Gaming Engine that the 3D Content is being built is Unity, Unreal Engine, Wonderland Engine or MetaVRse Engine, or coded using a WebXR Framework, the serving text and asset paths will make curating content in 3D worlds easy.

The Dominant CMS in Open Source

The reason that WordPress has enjoyed steady growth to become the leading content management tool on the web is it’s user-friendly interface makes it easy to store and organize information. Its ability to create custom content types, taxonomies, and store metadata gives admins the flexibility to structure their websites any way they want. WordPress is extensible with a library of over 50,000 plugins (with only 5 tagged as WebXR) allows for easy integrations to the themes, for every purpose from multilingualism (WPML) to e-commerce (Woo-Commerce has a 20% market share). It’s drag and drop menu interface makes it easy to create data hierarchies. Its REST API allows it to pass JSON formatted data to applications. All of these features are needed to facilitate the growth of the immersive web.

Privately held, Automattic, which is owned by WordPress founder Matt Mullenweg, executed a $250M stock buyback was valued at $7.5 Billion in August of 2021, makes WordPress a case study on the business model of supporting open-source. WordPress core remains 100% free. 

Demand for WebXR Destinations is an Opportunity for Publishers

Meta’s Quest Browser, combined with the availability of Wolvic becoming available on more XR device platforms, and Apple’s imminent entry into the market with Safari for xrOS, will make web based immersive experiences available across the largest install bases for headsets. These headset users need something to do, and the landscape of immersive websites remains a frontier.  Instead of publishers needing to hire specialized talent to curate websites and build for multiple operating systems, they can convert existing websites into immersive experiences and establish their presence in the Metaverse in an economical way.

title.rendered: Unleashing the Power of WebXR through WordPress

content.rendered:
Hundreds of millions of sites store their text, images, and assets in the WordPress CMS, yet only five results return in a search for WebXR in its plugin registry. JavaScript is the most widely used programming language in the world, yet only a small fraction of its developers has been onboarded to build using WebXR. Making it easy for large communities of developers to build immersive experiences provides a recipe for explosive growth.

Leveraging the prolific amount of content administrated through the user-friendly, industry leading WordPress CMS through integration with WebXR frameworks will accelerate the transition from the 2D to the 3D Web. By developing an open-source suite of WebXR themes and plugins, we will empower millions of users to create, share, and engage with immersive experiences.

Combining WebXR with WordPress will open the door for numerous potential partnerships and collaborations with their respective communities. Moreover, though integration with third-party open-source initiatives, APIs, and resources will make it easier for developers to publish robust immersive websites. This is not an attempt to convert WordPress into a game engine or 3D content creation tool, but rather, to take what it does so well… organize assets and make it available as data through the REST API that feeds JavaScript applications.

excerpt.rendered: Hundreds of millions of sites store their text, images, and assets in the WordPress CMS, yet only five results return in a search for WebXR in its plugin registry. JavaScript is the most widely used programming language in the world, yet only a small fraction of its developers has been onboarded to build using WebXR. […]

title.rendered: Addressing the Need for More WebXR Content

content.rendered:
The expected growth in the XR device market can only be achieved by creating demand through the availability of immersive content. Powersimple is a proponent of browser-based experiences because they are built on standards that are designed to endure and empower developers with the agency to create and deploy experiences across hardware platforms, without app stores acting as gatekeepers and payment gateways. This proposal provides a path to rapid proliferation of WebXR experiences by taking the approach of making it possible to convert existing 2D sites into immersive sites.

The projected Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of the XR industry in the next few years averages around 40%, for hundreds of billions of dollars, depending on which market forecast you choose to cite and what metrics they use. Factors such as Apple’s entry into the market, Meta’s follow up to their successful Quest line of standalone headsets, the release of WebGPU increasing the quality of graphics, the emergence of generative AI as an enabler for content creation, and cooperation on standards, among many others, makes the fulfillment of these high expectations inevitable. Consumer adoption of devices will be accelerated once there is enough content to make daily use of these devices, which will in-turn will drive demand for more immersive destinations. We are still far off from this tipping point, and this is a plan to help us prepare for that day, and help it arrive faster. The glaring absence of scalable immersive content administration infrastructure, combined with the obviousness of strategically leveraging existing content, makes it imperative to serve the nascent market of existing sites with 3D Options.  Websites don’t have to go immersive all at once. They can begin with a single page with a 3D template populated by content from the same CMS they’ve been using all along.

Powersimple is a proponent of browser-based experiences because they are built on standards that are designed to endure and empower developers with the agency to create and deploy experiences across hardware platforms, without app […]

content.rendered:
“I think it’s actually our obligation and duty to figure out on our side what can we do to make the VR platform take advantage of this trillion plus dollars of content on all of the flat screens.”

John Carmack, Meta Connect Keynote, 2021

This quote is an essential reminder, that there is an enormous amount of text, images, and video waiting to populate XR worlds.42% of all websites on the internet use WordPress as a Content Management System (CMS).  Our open-source project aims to make it easy to enable WebXR in WordPress using a customizable theme. This will empower content owners to publish their assets already stored in 2D sites into an immersive format.

The strategic approach of enabling entire content libraries stored in WordPress to be presented in WebXR will propel the growth of the Immersive Web, by allowing sites to gradually phase-in presentation of content in Virtual and Augmented Reality without having to change CMS platforms. WordPress’s impressive reach, with over 400 million websites using it, and a 64.3% share of the CMS market, makes converting WordPress websites into 3D Experiences a massive market opportunity which will draw developer talent to advance their careers in the Metaverse.

Over the past three years, Powersimple has been using WordPress as an effective admin tool to structure data and populate WebXR sites, with text and image content, and even interactive 3D models. This effectively bridges the gap between the 2D internet of the past and the Immersive Web of the future. The XROS Fellowship, sponsored by FICCI (Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry) and Meta, is sponsoring a stipend for six talented students who have been selected from a pool of 120 applicants, to dedicate over 2,000 hours of development time toward repackaging this open-source theme for mass-market use.  The project is guided by Ben Erwin, who has over 25-years of experience as a web developer, with 15 specializing in WordPress.

_thumbnail_id.desc:
“I think it’s actually our obligation and duty to figure out on our side what can we do to make the VR platform take advantage of this trillion plus dollars of content on all of the flat screens.”

John Carmack, Meta Connect Keynote, 2021

This quote is an essential reminder, that there is an enormous amount of text, images, and video waiting to populate XR worlds.42% of all websites on the internet use WordPress as a Content Management System (CMS).  Our open-source project aims to make it easy to enable WebXR in WordPress using a customizable theme. This will empower content owners to publish their assets already stored in 2D sites into an immersive format.

The strategic approach of enabling entire content libraries stored in Wordpress to be presented in WebXR will propel the growth of the Immersive Web, by allowing sites to gradually phase-in presentation of content in Virtual and Augmented Reality without having to change CMS platforms. WordPress's impressive reach, with over 400 million websites using it, and a 64.3% share of the CMS market, makes converting WordPress websites into 3D Experiences a massive market opportunity which will draw developer talent to advance their careers in the Metaverse.

Over the past three years, Powersimple has been using WordPress as an effective admin tool to structure data and populate WebXR sites, with text and image content, and even interactive 3D models. This effectively bridges the gap between the 2D internet of the past and the Immersive Web of the future. The XROS Fellowship, sponsored by FICCI (Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry) and Meta, is sponsoring a stipend for six talented students who have been selected from a pool of 120 applicants, to dedicate over 2,000 hours of development time toward repackaging this open-source theme for mass-market use.  The project is guided by Ben Erwin, who has over 25-years of experience as a web developer, with 15 specializing in WordPress.
